system.description: You send a message to others in the form of a dream. The message can be up to one word per caster level. The recipient remembers the dream upon waking. If the recipient is awake when you cast the spell, they know someone tried to contact them. You can choose to send a nightmare instead: the target does not get a save and takes 1d10 points of damage; the target is fatigued and cannot rest; after the nightmare the target remembers it. Alternatively, you can make the dream (or nightmare) appear to be a normal dream. To use the spell in this way, you must have touched the target. The target then gets a Will save; success means they realize the dream was sent by you.

components.materialDescription: A handful of sand, a dab of ink, and a small feather (quill).

system.target: One living creature known to you
system.savingThrow: None (harmless) or Will negates; see text
